body_html: I think this is working as intended: the generator passed to tf.data.Dataset.from_generator() is an opaque piece of Python as far as TensorFlow is concerned, and the iterator will block until a value is produced. The code in your Stack Overflow question doesn't block when I run it (nor did it when my colleague @jsimsa ran it).
body_text: I think this is working as intended: the generator passed to tf.data.Dataset.from_generator() is an opaque piece of Python as far as TensorFlow is concerned, and the iterator will block until a value is produced. The code in your Stack Overflow question doesn't block when I run it (nor did it when my colleague @jsimsa ran it).
body: I think this is working as intended: the `generator` passed to `tf.data.Dataset.from_generator()` is an opaque piece of Python as far as TensorFlow is concerned, and the iterator will block until a value is produced. The code in your [Stack Overflow question](https://stackoverflow.com/q/47917288/3574081) doesn't block when I run it (nor did it when my colleague @jsimsa ran it).
